Text: 'When you see a teenager with an MP3 player, they are probably not listening to classical music. Most people can name many pop groups, but if you ask my friends about Brahms, they won't know who he is. I am studying music at university, but my classmates don't know much about classical music either. If you don't know the composers, you probably don't have their music. The numbers are not good for classical music fans. Only 3% of concert tickets sold last year were for classical music, and classical music recordings sell only about 300 copies each. I find this hard to believe. Why are fewer people interested in classical music, which has been around for centuries? Older people blame TV and video games, but I don't think that's the reason. The truth is, classical music doesn't attract many people, especially teenagers, who buy the most music and concert tickets. Some teenagers do go to classical concerts, but they are few. I play in an orchestra, but I'm not a big classical music fan. I like many types of music, but I don't listen to much classical music. So why don't teenagers like classical music? First, the pace and rhythm of classical music, with its many mood changes, are difficult for us. We like to talk fast, play fast, and think fast. Experts say we can't focus for more than three minutes, which is too short for most classical pieces but perfect for a pop song. Pop music is simple and easy to listen to, while classical music needs time and focus. Pop music topics are more interesting to teenagers than long classical pieces without words. The way we listen to music has changed. In the past, families played music together at home, and playing an instrument was important. The only other way to hear music was at a concert. Now, you can find any music online, but we rarely listen to classical music. When was the last time you heard classical music in a shop? One of my teachers says more people are going to classical concerts now, but I think not many of them are teenagers. In my orchestra, we play classical music in many places, but I mostly see older people in the audience. I don't know why more people like classical concerts as they get older, but I know that if your parents love something, you might not like it. Some people say schools are to blame for teenagers not liking classical music, but many kids are excited to play in their school orchestra. They come early to practice and stay late to rehearse. They like classical music when they play it, but it's not their favorite music to listen to. When we want to relax, we choose pop music.'

Bonnie Wyndham got out of her mother’s car and looked at Almonside School. "I’ll make you sorry I’ve come here," she said quietly. Her mother was getting out of the car too, but she didn’t hear Bonnie. Mrs. Wyndham looked around. Almonside was a strange school with many buildings hidden among the trees on a hillside. It was confusing at first. Then she saw signs: Science block, gymnasium, riding centre… "Riding centre," said Bonnie, suddenly interested. "Headmaster’s study," said her mother. "This way." Bonnie followed her mother along a wide path between trees. "I wish you’d walk beside me," said Mrs. Wyndham tiredly, but she didn’t expect Bonnie to do so. A few minutes later, her mother was talking to Bonnie’s new headmaster in his office, while Bonnie waited outside. Suddenly, Bonnie stood up. "Why should I just sit here?" she thought. "I’ll be in trouble soon anyway," she thought, "so why not start now?" She left the building and went to the riding centre. There was an old building for the horses and a large place for indoor riding. Bonnie looked around, but no one was there. She was careful and respectful as she went to the horses. The horses were well cared for, she could see that. Almost every stall had a horse, and she looked at each one. "I know what they’re doing here," she told a small pony as she touched its nose. The next horse surprised her. "You’re the best!" she said. He was brown with a little white. He looked lively, but Bonnie liked that. "I feel like we’ve met before," said Bonnie, petting his neck. "In my dreams, I was riding you in a big competition…" His name was Maverick. She wanted to ride him. "I wonder where I can find a bridle and a saddle," she thought. The room with the riding equipment was unlocked. Bonnie was happy. She put a saddle on Maverick and forgot about her mother and the headmaster. When she sat on the big horse outside, she felt like a queen. Her nickname at her old school was Queen Bee, and she laughed. "You’re the best horse I’ve ever ridden, Maverick," she said. "I know about horses, even if I don’t know about other things." She made him walk, then trot. "If I stay here, we could be great friends," she said. She rode around the paddock. The movement was exciting, and the wind made her cheeks glow. She felt Maverick trusted her, and she was sure he would jump well.

I have met Cody Simpson before, and I always liked how he is quietly confident. Cody is a 15-year-old from Australia who has made many popular songs. But how did a relaxed surfer become a famous singer? Cody says, "I first played the guitar when I was six and started writing songs at seven." He remembers that he was swimming and surfing every day. These activities were very important to him. When he was 13, he was in high school and posted some videos online. These videos changed his life. He started by posting a video of him and a friend singing at a school concert. People liked it and asked for more videos. Cody made more videos at home and shared them. Many people loved them.

Cody was also a very good swimmer. He trained with top coaches and worked hard to be better. But then music companies noticed him, and he had to make a big decision: stay in Australia and keep swimming or move to the US for music. Cody decided to take the risk. "It was very hard for me to choose a career at such a young age," he says. He had to tell his swimming coach and friends that he was moving to the US. "It was a big surprise for many people. I am a quiet person," he says. Cody and his family moved to the US, leaving one dream to follow another. His family stays out of the spotlight but supports him. Cody thinks it is important to have good people around you to stay grounded.

Sometimes Cody worries about how his decision affects his younger brother and sister. His brother is eight and travels a lot, doing school on the road. Cody wonders if this is hard for him, but his family always supports him. Success comes from saying "yes" to big opportunities, even if they are scary. "Everything happened so fast," Cody says. "Now, I visit countries I never thought I would see and play for many fans. It is like a dream for many people, but I know it won't last forever."

I jumped out of bed and looked out the window at the river. There was a new crack in the ice shining in the morning sun. I looked at the sandbags we put up to stop the river from flooding when the ice melts. My back still hurt from lifting them. Last week, I worked with many people from the town to put the sandbags in place. My grandfather didn’t seem to notice my hard work. I looked at the river where the water was warm from the factory. There was a boy I didn’t know trying to walk on the ice. I put on my kayaking wetsuit and checked my pocket for a silver chain. My grandfather brought it back from South America. I also have his diary from that trip, which I read before bed. I went to the kitchen. 

“Morning, Rex,” Mom said with a smile as I took a banana. “You’re up early for a Saturday. I’ll make brunch after your training. Be careful.” 

“Thanks, Mom.” I walked down the hall and almost bumped into Grandpa. 

“Watch where you’re going!” he shouted. “Where are you going?” 

“Sorry, Grandpa. I’m going kayaking.” He should know this because I kayak every morning. Grandpa often gets angry, but I try to ignore it. 

“What’s the point of training? You didn’t win the competition,” he said. His words hurt, but I took a deep breath. He went into the bathroom and slammed the door. Mom came over with a kind smile. 

“Don’t mind him. He’s…” 

“…not himself at the moment,” I said. I didn’t say that he’s always been like this. When I was a child, he was my hero. He showed me photos of him in National Geographic magazine. Those photos are still on his wall with his medals and trophies. I don’t go into his room anymore. I have my own trophies now and hope to be in National Geographic one day. But part of me still wants to care about him. 

Mom smiled. “At least he’s coming out of his room more. Have a good session, Rex. I admire your determination, even on cold days!” 

I smiled back and peeled my banana. “It’ll be warmer in South America if I find sponsors for my trip.” She laughed and went back to the kitchen. I ate my banana and went outside to the boathouse.

Mum grabbed Jess by the arm. "Come with me," she said. Jess followed her to the study. On the table, leaning against the wall, was a painting. It was one of Grandpa's, but it looked different from his other work and was not finished. "Do you know anything about this?" Mum asked. Jess shook her head. "I've never seen it before. I didn't know he was working on anything." Jess looked at the picture. There was a river in it, but she didn't recognize it. Maybe it wasn't a real river, just an imaginary one. The picture was strange and beautiful in a mysterious way. The riverbank was barely there, just a little green, and the eye was drawn to the pale waters leading to a hidden sea. There were no animals, birds, or people, and it seemed right that way. It felt like there was no place for living things in this picture. Jess was fascinated, thinking of autumn coming after a long summer. Mum spoke again. "It has a name." Her voice sounded too casual, like she was hiding her excitement. Jess knew why. Grandpa never named his pictures. He just painted them and let others figure them out. Mum turned the picture over and showed Jess the words Grandpa had written. Jess read them aloud: "River Boy." The words seemed important to her, but she didn't know why. There was another mystery. She looked at Mum. "There is no boy." "Exactly. Strange, isn't it? Maybe he will add the boy later. I asked him about it." "Mum! You should have known better." "I know, but I couldn't help it. It's such an unusual picture, especially with a name. You can guess what he said." Jess didn't need to guess. She knew what Grandpa would have said. "He told you that artists don't need to explain their paintings because each picture has its own life and language, like a poem. We either understand it or we don't. And he said painting is hard enough without having to explain it to everyone." "He said 'ignoramus,'" Mum corrected, laughing. "Yes, every ignoramus. And if artists had to explain their pictures to everyone, they'd never get any work done. And he said..." Mum interrupted, still laughing. "Something like that. Anyway, I hoped you might know something about this painting since you seem to inspire him." "Inspire?" "Someone who gives an artist ideas." Jess knew what the word meant. Grandpa often used it when she watched him paint. He would say the muse wasn't helping him today or that he needed to be nice to the muse because he had a difficult part to paint. He never said the muse was her. She thought he meant a goddess, not a person. It was hard to imagine anyone, even a goddess, influencing Grandpa. "He doesn't need me to inspire him," she said. "He's been painting all his life."

This morning, I didn't plan to cut a hole in my bedroom carpet. I'm not saying it was an accident, but it could have been. For example, if I tripped with Dad's knife in my hand, the knife might have cut the carpet by itself. I'm not saying that happened, just that it could have. I didn't wake up thinking, "Today I will cut a hole in my carpet." It just seemed like a good idea at the time. Later, I wondered why I thought that, but it was too late. This happens to me a lot. I'm unlucky that way.

I was actually trying to fit my corner cabinet into a corner. Gran gave me the cabinet when she moved to a flat. It's small, white, with pink and blue flowers, and has tiny glass doors. Gran used to keep china ornaments in it. I keep my shells, fossils, and interesting stones there. I always loved Gran's cabinet, so I was excited when she gave it to me. But it's a corner cabinet, shaped like a triangle, so it needs to stand in a corner.

I only have two corners in my bedroom because it's the smallest room in the house, shaped like a wedge of cheese. The big front bedroom is Mum and Dad's; the one at the back is my sister Angela's; the little one over the garage is my brother Tom's; and the tiny one is mine. Mum says when Angela goes to University, Tom can have her room, and I can have his. But Angela is only fifteen, so I think I'll be in my small room for a long time. I don't mind; I like my little bedroom. It's cosy, like a nest. I love the sloping roof and the window at floor level. The only problem is the lack of corners! My bed is in one corner, and my wardrobe in the other. I tried to fit Gran's cabinet between the roof and the floor, but it was a little too tall. If I could just cut a few centimetres off the bottom... Then I thought, if I can't cut the cabinet, maybe I can cut the carpet. It seemed like the obvious solution. Dad calls this lateral thinking. He always tells us to "think outside the box," and that's what I was doing!

The novel 'The Borrowers' is about a family of tiny people who live hidden in a house. They secretly take things from normal-sized people to survive. When I was asked to direct a TV version of the novel, I knew it would be hard to meet people's expectations. Fans of the book have strong ideas about how it should look. I used the original drawings from the book because I didn't want people to say I got it wrong. The author wanted the series to show the Borrowers' view, not the humans', which made filming more difficult. The most important thing was getting the size right. The Borrowers are ten times smaller than humans, so we had to film from far away. When filming the Borrowers' world, the crew had to film from no higher than 15 centimeters. They wore out many pairs of jeans doing this! We never raised the cameras above their height except for aerial shots. One big challenge was making the shadows look right when mixing images of tiny Borrowers with normal-sized backgrounds. We created a special technique for this. After the series aired, famous US director George Lucas called to ask how I did it. The only set we built was the Borrowers' home under the floorboards, with giant objects to make the actors look small. It was very surreal. When I asked them to carry big things like giant scissors, they really got into it. I remember the coins were bigger than dinner plates and hard to lift. We often had to stop filming because the crew laughed so much. In the story, there’s a scene where the Borrowers are swept down a drain. To film this, actors had to be swept down a tunnel with hoses and said it was so scary, they didn’t have to act. Getting the costumes right was important to me. I made them from heavy canvas so they stuck out like dolls’ clothes. This made it hard for the lead actress to bend in her costume. She couldn’t sit during breaks and had to be sewn into her dress every morning. The lead actor's trousers were made from a rug because normal material looked too smooth. Unfortunately, it was very hot during filming. I don’t think they thanked me for the costumes! Most scenes away from the Borrowers’ home were filmed with actors in front of a blue screen. It was hard for them to react to things that weren't there. I drew pictures of every scene to show how each should look – I did 2,000 by the end. They weren’t perfect, but they worked. We didn’t have money for special effects studios during the day, so I worked nights for three months. We had to work fast – I once filmed a whole scene without film in the camera. But it all came together, and I think the series showed the magic of the books.

Mom stops the car at the corner of my new school, Palm Grove High School. She looks around nervously, checking for journalists, but there are none. I wonder how long it will be before things get crazy. It always happens: fake smiles, people pretending to be friends, and asking for free tickets to my dad’s concerts. "Everything’s going to be fine," I tell her. She kisses her fingertip and touches my cheek before I get out of the car. Then she drives away, leaving me to face this new school and new situation. But this is what I wanted. I wanted to leave my old life of traveling and tutors. While the band is here for recording, we are staying for good. I wanted to come to this school to meet real kids. Maybe a kid with a mom who works in an office or a dad who cuts grass. That would be so cool and normal. 

I walk into the school’s main office. "Hi, I need my schedule, please," I say to the school secretary. "Name?" she asks, not very friendly. "Desert McGraw." "Desirée?" she asks, leaning closer. "Desert," I repeat. She seems confused. "Oh," she says and types "McGraw" on her keyboard. Not many people recognize my last name because my dad uses a stage name. "What grade?" "Eleventh." "One second, it’s printing," she says. She hands me the schedule. English Literature is my first class. I like English, so that’s good. I’ll be late, though. English is in Room 214, on the second floor. I studied the map last night so I wouldn’t get lost. 

When I reach the door, the teacher is already calling roll. "Aurelio Gonzalez." "Here." I quietly slip in and sit at the last desk in the second row. The girl next to me smiles. She looks at my outfit – jeans and a T-shirt. Ha! No one will suspect anything now! "Nice shoes," she whispers. I look at my expensive shoes with flowers. Oh no, I shouldn’t have worn these. "Thanks," I say. The teacher pauses. "Desert... McGraw?" she says. "Here." The teacher smiles and says her name is Ms. Smigla. She talks a lot and gives us our course outlines. After we review them, she lets us socialize. All teachers should do this. 

"So why’d you move here?" my new friend asks. I have many choices. Do I say I wanted a normal life away from cameras and reporters? Or the real reason, according to Dad? "We need a change, Desert," he said, "and this is the perfect place to record the new album." Personally, I think he just wants to relax on the beach. Why else pick a studio near the sand? "My dad had to relocate," I tell her. Yes, lies work better. "What does he do?" she asks. Oh well, everyone will find out soon. But I can pretend to be normal for a while. "He’s an artist," I say, playing with my backpack zipper. "Cool. I’m Becca, by the way." And she doesn’t seem to care. Perfect.

Text: 'Today, American teenage girls are expected to do many things. They should be the Student Council president, have a part-time job, volunteer, and do well in everything. This is what it means to be a teenager in America now. Teenage boys and girls cannot just go to school and be average. Being average is not enough anymore. People think that not having big goals is being lazy. 

Teenager Kristen Loose says, 'People forget how much pressure teenagers have now. We have a lot of homework, tests, activities after school, jobs, chores, and responsibilities at home. We also try to have a social life.' Even though these pressures are normal for teenagers today, people still have negative ideas about them. They think teenagers are lazy, disrespectful, rebellious, loud, reckless, and self-centered. While some teenagers might be like this, it is not fair to say all teenagers are the same.

Kristen Loose says people think teenagers spend most of their time watching TV and using their phones. She thinks this is not true. She keeps her phone close, but not just for fun. It helps her and other teenagers manage their busy lives. People expect students to be connected to the world all the time, which can look like a phone addiction. With smartphones, tablets, and social media, students can do their work anywhere. They can even listen to lessons while going to school. Schoolwork and activities now need attention all the time, making teenagers very busy.

Many teenagers start their day at 6 a.m. or 7 a.m. and finish after midnight. Their day is full of school, activities, family duties, and homework. They often get less than the nine hours of sleep they need. A survey found that only 20% of American teenagers get enough sleep. Also, 28% of teenagers said they fall asleep in school at least once a week because they are so tired.

Teenager Lindamarie Olsen says she has about 18 hours of free time each week. With 168 hours in a week, 18 hours is not much. Olsen does not waste this time on social media or TV. She spends a lot of her free time volunteering. She says, 'People think teenagers only care about themselves, but I love helping others. I want to make a positive impact in my school and community.'

In 20 years, the stereotype of teenagers might change, but they will still prove it wrong. There will be a new generation of students who will make a big impact on the world before they even finish school.'

The teenage members of the Earth to Sky Calculus Club live in and around Bishop, a small town in the US near the Sierra Nevada mountains. This group has launched over fifty balloons to the edge of space, about 35 km above the Earth. Their project is both a science experiment and an adventure, which is why teenagers like it. I joined them one weekend in late spring. They were about to release a high-altitude balloon to try to record shooting stars. Shooting stars happen when a rock or metal from space enters the Earth's atmosphere, creating a light trail. 

As it got dark, the teenagers attached a soft $5 lunch box to the balloon. Inside the box, there was a camera, a tool to measure altitude, and a thermometer. Two GPS trackers were on the outside to help find the box later. A gas tank, given by someone from a nearby state, was used to fill the balloon, which grew to the size of a small car. An older boy had driven seven hours to get the gas. ‘I didn’t really mind,’ he said. For kids in this club, that’s normal. Finally, it was time to launch. ‘Five, four, three, two, one,’ they counted, and the balloon went up. Some of them ran and followed it with flashlights until it disappeared into the night. There was a quiet and a feeling of wonder. 

After the launch, most students went home, but a few stayed to watch the shooting stars. They lay on blankets on the mountainside and looked at the clear sky. It was hard to believe they were just four hours from Los Angeles, a big city with about 4 million people. I saw a boy get into a sleeping bag and fall asleep. ‘We’re the only ones talking,’ said one girl quietly. ‘I know,’ whispered another. A meteor crossed the sky. 

As the balloon rises, the air pressure drops, and the balloon gets bigger until it pops. A parachute helps the lunch box land safely back on Earth. The students will find it the next day using the GPS trackers. Finding it is not easy, but that’s part of the fun. The lunch box usually lands in a remote area. ‘Recoveries are a big part of the program,’ said the group’s leader. They have lost only two lunch boxes in 53 launches. ‘We have learned a lot about this landscape,’ he said. 

This time, the lunch box landed 84 km west of Bishop. To get it, the team had to drive south of the Sierra and then back up the other side. They had to decide whether to drive or walk, as it could be dangerous if the lunch box was on a high peak or in a tall tree. ‘These students are from the Eastern Sierra,’ their leader said. ‘What seems wild to some is normal for them.’ It took them 11 hours to find the lunch box. It was on a flat rock in a canyon, in the middle of a waterfall. The camera didn’t record any shooting stars. It was a bit disappointing, but it was a chance to talk about atmospheric waves and how they work over mountains. It was also another adventure story to share.

Chloe Morgan didn't like science or Palaeontology much until she was fifteen. It happened by chance. Her younger brother loved dinosaurs, which is common for kids, but Chloe didn't care about them. She helped him with a science project and found an article about new dinosaur discoveries. It amazed her, and she knew she wanted to learn more about it.

Chloe met her first palaeontologist, Matt Cornelius, who was already famous. She was nervous because she thought he might find her annoying with her questions. But he was patient and listened to her, which made her feel better.

Chloe talks about how movies and TV shows show palaeontologists. She says movies like Jurassic Park make people interested in dinosaurs but not always in Palaeontology. She thinks movies often show palaeontologists as strange or nerdy, which is not true. Her job is very different. She digs up dinosaur bones, works in labs, and writes for science magazines. She also likes to explain science to people, especially young ones, to help them understand more about science.

Chloe helped with a TV show called Walking with Dinosaurs. She made sure the dinosaurs looked right and lived in the same time period. The show was popular because it showed dinosaurs in a new way, different from movies like Jurassic Park.

Chloe thinks dinosaurs are interesting because they make us curious and remind us there is still more to discover. Palaeontology is like traveling back in time.

When you travel by car with your family, even if you are six years old, you probably know you are not "there yet," even if you keep asking, "Are we there yet?" Once you arrive, it becomes "here," not "there." So, you should ask, "Are we here yet?" Parents probably want to be "there" more than kids do because they hear this question a lot during long trips.

Think about it: as kids, we can relax in the back seat. We can watch DVDs, listen to music, or do puzzles while the scenery passes by outside. In the front seat, mum or dad gives us juice boxes, cookies, and changes the radio or temperature. They make sure everything is okay during the trip.

But sometimes, things go wrong. My younger brother, Tim, might put his foot on my side of the seat. I do the same, and soon we are fighting. Mum or dad has to stop us and tell Tim to stay in his seat. Then, we calm down and enjoy the view again.

Later, I might feel a breeze on my arm. Tim is blowing air at me from his seat. He is not touching me, so he thinks he is not doing anything wrong. I get angry, and Tim gets in trouble again. Then, we calm down once more.

Dad has ways to deal with us. When we ask, "Are we there yet?" he sometimes says, "Yes, get out of the car." But we are still on the highway, so we know we are not there yet. This makes us quiet for a while.

You know you are finally "there" when the adults get out of the car and move away from the kids. So remember, if mum and dad can still answer your question, then no, you are not there yet.

John and Zuzi Morgan have opened a café in Oxford, UK. In their café, people can drink coffee, eat cake, and play board games. John and Zuzi hope people will enjoy this and come back again. Zuzi says they started this business because people spend too much time on phones and gadgets. They want people to talk and have fun together without screens.

The games in their café are called 'Eurogames'. These games have simple themes like farming. The first Eurogame was The Settlers of Catan, made by Klaus Teuber from Germany. In this game, players build settlements and trade resources. Everyone stays involved until the end, and no one feels left out. Later, 'co-operative' games were made where everyone wins or loses together. This makes people talk and work together more. 

One popular co-operative game is Pandemic, made by Matt Leacock from North America. In Pandemic, players work together to solve global problems. Leacock was inspired by another Eurogame called Lord of the Rings. He wanted to make games that are fun whether you win or lose. As a child, Leacock loved games but was often disappointed by them. With his uncle, he tried to make better games. Pandemic became very popular, and its new version has a lot of storytelling, like video games.

Video games have helped board games become popular. Many people play games on their phones now. Ben Hogg, who works for a games company, says more people are open to playing games today. Before, people played video games together in the same room. Now, many video games are played online, and players are not in the same place. So, some people want to play games with others in person again.

John and Zuzi's café shows that board games are more than just fun. In our online world, games are a way to connect with others in real life. This trend is likely to continue.

Jamie Scott has written and produced many big UK songs. His story shows why you need to keep trying in the music business, even if things don't go well at first. Jamie's mother was a great singer and taught him to play the guitar. At home, he only listened to a radio station for older people, which influenced him as he grew up. He was 12 when he first heard a modern song. Around that time, he had to choose between playing tennis, which he was very good at, and music. He spent his school lunchtimes playing the piano. Jamie says, "I was good at tennis, but I didn't want to do it forever. It was too hard." At 17, he left school to become a performer. He was in a duo with a friend who played guitar well but didn't want a music career. Jamie told his parents he wanted to make music. His dad gave him 18 months to succeed, or he would have to find a job. After some close calls with record labels, he got a music deal at 19 because of one song. But the labels wanted him to be a solo artist, so he left his friend. Jamie became famous behind the scenes, not on stage. After a tough time with a UK record label, he moved to another label to release a new album, but he didn't become famous. Jamie says, "As an artist, I was often in the wrong place at the wrong time. But as a writer, I was in the right place." Writing songs for others is where he succeeded. He says, "I think I'm one of the main writers in the UK, helping new artists start their careers." He sometimes tells artists that writing popular songs is okay. He asks, "Don't you want 10 million people to listen to your music next month?" Jamie wants to write great songs that sell well. He is honest about wanting to write number-one songs. He knows he has the talent to do it. Jamie says, "When I work with someone, we aim to write the best music for next year. It's not just about being cool. We want to write classic modern pop songs."

Tony Connor is a new kind of famous person. He is very popular online, but many people who don't watch online videos might not know him. Tony is a 'street trials cyclist.' This means he does tricks on his bike, like jumping from a roof to a wall. These tricks are filmed and shared online.

I met Tony at a BMX park on a Saturday morning. Many local boys knew him, and even older people came to say he is a 'legend.' After watching his skills, I agreed. I was surprised by his bravery and creativity. Before each trick, Tony explains what he will do, and sometimes I can't believe he will succeed. But he always does. When I tell him how great he is, he doesn't seem very excited. Even though he is famous online, Tony says he doesn't like being a celebrity. He finds it hard to talk to fans and prefers doing tricks instead.

Tony's fame comes from social media and new camera technology. This technology helps him make a living from his videos. He says, 'This technology gives people like me a chance to earn money.' But he also thinks people spend too much time with cameras and screens. Still, he is happy because he can make money from what used to be just a hobby.

I have learned that to become a top athlete, you need energy and the ability to handle disappointment. These are more important than talent. In risky sports, you need mental strength. Even in the park, Tony fell a few times but got up and tried again until he succeeded.

Not everyone thinks Tony is a hero. Some people say he takes too many risks. Tony says these people don't understand his sport. They don't know he gets advice from experts to stay safe. Tony is careful about risks. He says, 'Some people never get scared, but they shouldn't do these sports. It's good to know the dangers. I feel fear but find a way to overcome it. I plan and prepare a lot. Sometimes I ride around to get ready before a new trick. I know I must be confident before I jump. If I am fully committed, I am okay.'

Television presenter Helen Skelton has done many dangerous things for charity. She has run a marathon in the desert and traveled down the Amazon River in a small boat. For her latest challenge, Helen walked on a high wire. This is a long, thin piece of metal, 66 meters above the ground, between two towers of an empty power station. There was no safety net. She only had a belt around her waist connected to another wire above. To help her keep her balance and not fall, she carried a long stick that weighed eight kilograms. Helen learned from an expert high-wire walker. Even though she knew some circus skills, she found out that high-wire walking was very different. ‘The training was a surprise,’ said Helen. ‘I didn’t know how strong I needed to be. Every day started at 8 am with a run up a steep hill. Then I did an hour of exercises, and another hour after practicing on the wire. I also had to learn how to fall onto the wire so that if I slipped, I could continue. Every time I fell on the wire, it hurt a lot. But it was important to stay positive: if I was nervous and started shaking, the wire would shake too!’ On the day of the challenge, it was windy. Helen stayed calm by taking deep breaths as she moved step by step along the wire. The 150-meter walk took 15 minutes. ‘That was the scariest thing I’ve done,’ she said afterward. ‘I’m glad it’s over!’ But Helen is still planning her next charity project: to reach the South Pole by ski, kite, and bike.

In 2006, Jeff Somers started a trip around the world on a penny farthing. A penny farthing is an old bicycle with one big wheel and one small wheel. Before this, Jeff wrote a book about traveling in Canada in a very old car. He loved motor sports and worked on building racing car engines. To save money, Jeff rode an old bicycle to work and even used it to go on holiday to Amsterdam. ‘That trip made me want to see the world by bike,’ he says. Jeff didn’t want a normal bike, and he wanted to build one himself. ‘The craziest bike I could think of was a penny farthing, so I went to the museum to learn how to make one.’ After two failed attempts in 2001 and 2003 because of a knee injury, he finally started his journey in 2006. He traveled for three years through 23 countries on four continents. The best part of his trip was reaching Tibet and seeing Mount Everest. ‘I met cyclists who could ride up mountains, which I couldn’t do, but I never regretted my penny farthing. The further I traveled, the more amazed people were by it.’ His worst moment was when he had to drink dirty water from a stream. He got very sick and stayed in bed for ten days without medicine. He had no money for hospital bills or to go home. Despite all this, Jeff says, ‘if I had the money, I would start traveling again tomorrow on my penny farthing.’

I work at a university in the US. My team and I are studying water birds, especially the American black duck. We have started using a new tool called a 'night-vision scope'. This tool helps us see the ducks at night. We are worried about black ducks because their numbers have gone down a lot. We are not sure if there is enough food for them on the east coast. We know a lot about what they do during the day, but not at night. Before, we did not have the right equipment to see them at night. But now, with this new scope, we can see them clearly, even when there is no moon. This will help us learn more and take better care of the places where they live.

The work is very hard. There are four people on our team, and each of us works six hours every day. We have studied ducks in different places. I have to take a boat to some places and write down notes about every duck I see. The weather is not always good. Some nights are nice, but often it is rainy. It is so quiet that I need a lot of coffee to stay awake! We have only missed one day of work because the snow was too deep, even for our special snow vehicles. I like the challenge of this work. In the summer, we will spend hours in a laboratory looking at our results. It will be hard to stay inside, but it is important to do this. I would not change my job for anything!

When I tell people about my job, they are surprised. But it's true! I work by eating chocolate. My job is to make sure the chocolate from my company is perfect. Every week, I get small pieces of chocolate from our factory. I check how they taste, feel, and smell. I also taste the nuts and fruits we use in the chocolate. I spend time picking the best ones. Next to my office, I have a kitchen. There, I can make and taste chocolate. I give some to my work friends, and they like it! My kitchen has many machines and ingredients. It is nice to have my own space to work. Every day is different in my job. Sometimes I am in the food lab, and other times I travel to buy ingredients. I have a young family, so traveling can be hard. But I like the change and not having a routine. The best part is still the chocolate! People often ask if I get tired of chocolate. I have worked with it for a long time, but I still love eating it. I even eat more chocolate at home in the evening!

Have you ever thought about what it's like to perform in a circus? Sophia Grayson works at Circus Experience, a place where young people learn circus skills. Her course is popular because it teaches many skills, like juggling, throwing and catching things like balls or even fire, and trapeze, which is flying through the air above an audience. The course lasts one year, and students slowly take more risks in each class. Parents can come to some classes to see how their children are doing. 

Sophia says that for a circus career, performers need to do different things all the time. It is important to keep performances exciting and full of action. If you want to be successful in the circus, you must keep practising. Another great part is making friends with other performers and learning from them. Being fit is also very important. Circus artists, like athletes, train every day to stay strong. Training is important, but the best performers are those who want to succeed, have imagination, and always try to improve their skills. People often think you might get hurt or only work a little each year. But the real challenge is planning for the future because you can only travel with the circus while you are young, and then you need to think about other jobs.

The course also teaches business planning. Many students from the past have started businesses around the world and like to share their experiences. Sophia warns that it is not a job for making a lot of money. The work usually means not having a regular salary. It is also competitive, but it is a lot of fun!

Mariam Hobson is a professional backing singer. This means she sings behind the main singer. You might not know her name or face, but you have probably heard her sing many times. Some people think backing singers are not good enough to be lead singers, but that is not true. They need to be very good. People like Mariam are important in the music world!

Mariam loves her job because it is different every day. When she goes to the recording studio, she never knows what she will sing. It could be classical, jazz, hip-hop, or rock music. Sometimes, she sings funny songs for radio or advertisements. Once, she had to sing like a fish underwater! She never argues and just does her job.

Mariam needs to be very good at music and learn quickly. Sometimes, there is no music to read. She remembers her first time recording music for a film. It was hard because there were eight singers and an orchestra. She was scared because if she made a mistake, they would have to record everything again. Recording takes a long time.

Mariam also likes working with songwriters. Some new songwriters do not know which music is best for a female voice. When they hear Mariam sing their song, they can learn how to make it better.

Julie Deane started with only a little fashion knowledge and created a successful business with her 'satchels' - a traditional school bag. These bags are now sold in famous shops and are popular with celebrities. Before choosing to make satchels, Julie thought about different businesses, like cake decorating and party planning. She wanted to choose the best idea. Not everyone agreed with her choice, but Julie believed in her idea. She worked with her mother, who had never had a job but was good at business. The design of the bags came from children's storybooks. Julie didn't know much about fashion blogs, but they helped her a lot. At first, she sold about one satchel a week. To get more interest, she sent satchels to fashion writers, hoping they would write about them. They did, and more people became interested. Now, her company makes satchels faster. Julie enjoys seeing which celebrity has a satchel. Instead of spending money on online ads, she uses the internet to get ideas for new styles. This keeps her products fresh and exciting. There was a difficult time when another company copied her design. Now, she makes sure she trusts her production team. People say her office has a good feeling, and everyone likes working there. There is a new factory, but the team is what makes it special.

When Vicky Harmiston was a child, her parents let her and her brother Jamie choose what to do in their free time. Vicky decided to try many sports. She was a good swimmer, and her coach thought she could become a champion. But the swimming club was far from her home, so it was hard for her to train and do her schoolwork. 

When they were teenagers, Jamie loved cycling and bought a special racing bike. He started joining competitions. Vicky thought it looked exciting and decided to try cycling too. She says it was the best choice she ever made. Soon, she was cycling every day and doing very well. The track was near her school, so she could easily go to training after school. Vicky had a successful career in track cycling and won many competitions. When she was 28, she stopped competing. Vicky said, ‘I loved winning, but I got tired of it. When the excitement stops, there’s no point.’ Luckily, she started a new career.

Vicky got a job with a charity called CycleZone. ‘We work with young people who don’t like sports,’ she says. ‘First, we teach them to ride a bike. We want them to believe in themselves. CycleZone does a great job and brings young people together.’ The charity uses famous people to help advertise their work. Vicky says, ‘Some people think celebrities only help to make themselves look good, and this can hide the real work of the charity. But if famous singers and actors can help, I think they should.’

Ana Ronson is a singer and songwriter from Ireland. Her parents were not musicians, but there was always music at home. Her grandfather played the guitar and taught Ana and her brother how to play. The first time Ana sang in front of people was at school. She was very nervous, and her teacher had to help her off the stage. The teacher suggested she join the school theatre club to become more confident. After some time in the club, she sang with 50 other students at a concert and felt happy.

A year later, Ana's brother, who was in a band, asked her to write a song for them. She wrote her first song, Falling Stars, in just three days. She liked writing songs so much that she joined a songwriting course with a professional songwriter. Even though she was the youngest student, she knew a lot about music. But Ana felt the teacher did not listen to her, so she wrote a song called Something to Say about her feelings. She put this song online, and it became very popular. People left comments saying they loved it and found new meanings in the words.

Joss Alton, who owns a recording company called Isotope Music, came from the other side of Ireland to ask Ana to join Isotope. At first, Ana was unsure because she did not know the company and did not want anyone to tell her what to sing. But Joss promised this would not happen, and soon Ana performed at a concert in Dublin organized by Isotope. The tickets sold out quickly, and it was a great night.

Ana says she likes to write songs about difficult times because she has more to say. One of her favorite songs is Decision, about why her brother stopped singing for a while and how it made him sad. Ana hopes people will like her songs, but her main goal is to write about personal experiences that are important to her.

Last year, I went on a great trip. I traveled by boat on a guided group tour along the west coast of Canada. It was my brother Harry’s idea. He is a journalist, like me, and he wanted to write articles about the trip. He loves boats, but I do not. I wanted to visit the area because I saw it on TV when I was a child. I also knew our great-grandparents lived there before moving to Europe. So, I kept asking Harry if I could go too, and he finally said yes!

A few days before we left, there were storms in the area we were going to. But luckily, the weather forecast said the sea would be calm when we were there. I was busy at work and did not have much time to think about the trip. But Harry promised he would take care of everything, so I stopped worrying.

After arriving in Canada, we joined the group. We packed our things into small boats and started our journey. The guide said very few people lived along that coast. On the first morning, we only saw dolphins and birds. There were islands far away, but the fog made it hard to see them. I watched the beautiful patterns our boat made in the water.

We often stopped for hours to explore the rock pools on the beaches. They were full of amazing colored fish, many of which I did not know. It was nice not to worry about time. We always made lunch and dinner together over campfires. When we went to sleep on the boats each night, even though the beds were hard, it felt very relaxing!

When it was time to leave, I was sad. How could I go back to normal life? But I knew I would miss my family and friends if I stayed. I was also excited to tell everyone at home about our adventures!

My dad was a professional basketball player in Germany, just like his father. When I was a kid, I went to watch many of his games. You might think I would love basketball because of this, but I didn't. I liked telling my friends how good my dad was, especially when he won, but I usually took a book to read instead of watching the games. 

When I started secondary school, I was not yet a teenager, but I was already two meters tall. My sports teacher saw my height and asked if I wanted to train with the basketball team. I enjoyed the training session, but I thought I needed to get better before playing in a real game. However, my teacher believed in me more than I did. After a few weeks, I played my first game against another school. My mum and dad came to watch, which made me nervous, but it went well in the end!

For the next four years, I practiced every day and did really well. I even joined an adult team before moving to a special sports academy in the USA when I was fifteen. The coach there trains Olympic basketball players, and it was amazing to work with him. But I didn't like being far from my parents at first. At home, I didn't have much time with friends because of training, so that part didn't change much. I got used to my new life, and my English got better quickly too!

I became a professional basketball player at eighteen, three years after moving to the USA. I was taller than most players in the professional league since I was fifteen, but I was too light for my height, so I had to work on that. My coach knew a team that would take me while I was still in college, so I joined them and have never regretted it.

Seven years ago, I was studying Tourism at college. I needed a part-time job because my course was expensive. I thought about different jobs and decided to become a weekend tour guide in my city, Chicago, USA. I took visitors around the city and found out that I really liked it. I saw my city in a new way, like the tourists did. After I finished my studies, I wanted to be a full-time tour guide. I thought it would be easy, but I learned that I needed to know a lot more to get a licence. In Chicago, guides must answer many questions about the city, like its buildings, history, and transport rules. After some hard but interesting months, I got my tour guide qualification and became an independent tour guide. Being a tour guide is not just about knowing facts or keeping the group together. You need other skills too. You should be fun and tell good stories. You also need to handle changes, like if a place is closed or a route changes. Tourists want to enjoy the tour, not hear about problems. I need to make sure visitors are happy, or they might write a bad review online. Good reviews are important because they bring more customers. That’s why I make my tours fun and easy. I put a lot of energy into my job, so my reviews are usually very good, and people often recommend my tours to others visiting Chicago.

My name is Ella, and I am 22 years old. Last year, I went to Thailand for two weeks with my sister, Josie. Josie is five years younger than me, but we get along well. We went to Thailand to help as volunteers at an elephant sanctuary. This is a place where people take care of sick and rescued elephants. At first, I was not sure if we would have much in common with the other volunteers because they were older than us. We were also nervous because it was our first time doing something like this. But in the end, we did not need to worry.

One of our main jobs at the sanctuary was to collect food for the elephants. Elephants eat a lot of grass and banana plants, so this took most of the day. Josie found it hard work, but I thought it was worth it to see the elephants happy. We also helped wash the elephants in the river with big brushes and soap. I had a lot of fun doing this, even though I got very wet!

In the evening, we took the elephants to the forest where they stayed at night. All the volunteers lived in the same house. Josie and I shared a bedroom, so it was a bit small. We chose to share because Josie did not want to be alone. It was hot and humid, especially at night, but we knew it would be like that. The food was delicious and did not have meat, which we liked because we do not eat meat. After dinner, we talked and played games with the other volunteers and staff.

Now that we are back in the UK, Josie does not talk much about Thailand. But if someone asks her if she liked it, she says she loved it. I am not sure she is telling the truth. I think she might be a little upset because she missed her friends too much and did not enjoy her time there fully. But when she thinks about it, she knows she was lucky to go. Maybe she will go back one day—I know I will!

My name is Gina D’Costa, and I have a flower shop in the UK. We sell flowers to many different people. Some people buy flowers for their friends or homes. Hotels and offices also like to have flowers in their reception areas. Sometimes, we help with photo sessions for businesses by giving them flowers for their pictures. Once, I even decorated a castle with flowers for a wedding. It was a lot of work, but I was very happy with what we did.

My day starts very early at 4 a.m. I go to the market to buy fresh flowers. Most people are still sleeping at that time, and my friends think I am crazy, but I love my job. It is often cold and dark, but I don’t mind. The flower market is amazing, with flowers from all over the world. There are so many colors and smells, which makes it hard to choose. If I chose for myself, I would pick only pink flowers because pink is my favorite color. But I have to remember that other people might like different colors. Not all flowers are available all year, so sometimes I can’t find what customers want.

I don’t really like arguing about prices with the flower sellers, but it is part of the job. Flowers can be expensive, so I try to get the best price. Back at the shop, we look at what customers have ordered and put flowers in vases. Then we make flower bunches and decide how much they will cost. Customers are often surprised by the price, and I sometimes ask them to think again about what they want. Some people might think this is too much work, but I enjoy making the nicest flowers for the money someone wants to spend. That’s what you do when you sell things, and I wouldn’t want any other job!

My city has a modern cinema that shows all the new films I want to see. It also shows many films for kids on the weekends. The cinema is close to my home. But a year ago, I felt something was missing. I wanted to talk about films with people after watching them. So, I started a film club with two friends!

We decided not to rent a cinema for our club. Instead, we pick a new place in the city each month to show a film. For example, we used an old factory to show a film set in Antarctica. It was very cold, which made the film feel more real and exciting! Some places let us use their space for free because they sell snacks during the film. This helps us keep our ticket prices low. We only want to cover our costs, not make money.

Each time we show a film, it gets easier. We have our own equipment now, and we sell tickets online, so we know how many people will come. There is still a lot to do, but when people of all ages tell us they had a great time, it feels wonderful. Our website helps us connect with other film clubs in the country. We visit them to see how they do things, but we love coming back to our own club.

We also started a blog because most people look online for film information now. We tried putting posters in cafés, but the best way to get people is when others tell their friends about us. The audience loves the special activities we do with each film. Last month, we had a movie quiz, and everyone enjoyed it!

When I was a child, I loved taking photos. At 15, I wanted to make my hobby more serious. So, I started a special project: I would take one photo every day for a year. Many young photographers had done this before, but I thought it was a great idea. After a few weeks, I put my photos on a website for young photographers. I wanted to make a photo diary and show my photos to others. I was happy to see that people liked my photos. I enjoyed taking pictures of many different things. Then, someone told me that my project would be better if all my photos had a common theme. I agreed and started taking more photos of nature, like birds and the sky. Many of my photos were in black and white, which was different because most young photographers took color photos. Sometimes, I doubted my project and almost stopped. But I trusted myself and became more confident in my style. One day, I showed my project to my art teacher. She told me about a national photography competition for people my age. I entered some of my photos for fun. I was so happy when the judges said I won first prize. It was the first time I thought my photography was really good, and maybe I could be a professional photographer. Now, I have my own photography studio, and I am happy with my career choice.

I joined the National Youth Challenge (NYC) last year because I wanted to try new things like camping, sailing, and public speaking. In the NYC, you can do different activities to challenge yourself and learn new skills. There are different levels, from beginner to advanced, and adult volunteers called 'leaders' help you. When you finish a level, you get a certificate.

When I first joined, my leader suggested I help organize activities at a local children’s club for two hours a week. I wasn’t sure about it because I had been to that club when I was eight and found it hard to make friends. I was shy, and the other children already had their own friends, so I stopped going after a few weeks. But I decided to try the challenge because I wanted my first NYC certificate.

Soon, I wanted to spend all my free time at the children’s club. It became more important to me than just getting the certificate. When I finished the challenge, the NYC leader let me keep volunteering at the club because I made good friends with the children. Now I go there for about four hours a week, and I really enjoy it.

Because of my time at the children’s club, I decided that when I finish school in three years, I want to go to college to become a youth worker, someone who works with children. I never thought about this before joining the club. This has been my favorite part of the NYC, and I have improved my communication skills while helping others. I have several other NYC certificates now, and one of them is for camping!

I was born in Denver, USA. I started snowboarding when I was eight years old. My dad took me to a mountain resort two hours from Denver. The hill looked very steep, and my dad had to convince me to try snowboarding. I was young and had not thought about snowboarding, but my dad loved it and wanted me to love it too. He made it look easy. In the end, I did well. After this, I started to love snowboarding and got better at it. I began competing when I was ten. Some people do many competitions and get bored, but I still love competing and winning. This helps me try harder. I like not having a fixed plan. Once, I got a perfect score of 100 at a local competition. I wasn’t sure I would try the jumps that got me this score until I started. This made me trust my abilities more. In the summer, I focus on training and studying because there is no snow. I train every day, but I don’t have to follow a strict diet like in winter. I also spend a lot of time with my friends. This helps me when I can’t snowboard, which I love and am good at. I have to think about my future. Snowboarding is a big part of my life, but I also want to have another option in case I don’t become a professional snowboarder or if I get hurt. I am thinking about becoming a doctor if I have time to study at college. I can’t imagine getting tired of snowboarding, but I know I can’t do it my whole life.

When I was fifteen, I wanted everything my friends had. I didn't think about the future. For example, I didn't know what I wanted to do after school. One day, my best friend got a new phone for her birthday. I wanted one too. My parents said I could have a phone if I paid for it myself. So, I decided to work part-time and save money. This taught me an important lesson. I worked every Saturday in a café, but I didn't like it. My parents suggested I start my own small business. I saw my mum making necklaces, so I asked if I could try. I thought it would be hard, but it was easy for me. My friends thought it was boring, but I liked it. Mum showed me how to make nice things at home with simple tools. I sold my first jewellery to friends and family. They said they liked them, but I thought they were just being nice. I wanted to know if other people would like them too. So, I rented a market stall with my mum. Many tourists bought my jewellery to take home as gifts. Soon, people from all over the country called to buy more. They thought we were a big company, but it was just me and my mum at the market stall! Then I knew it could work, so I made a website. Since then, I have made a lot of money from my business, mostly online, but we still have our stall too. It has been a lot of fun.

When Janine Stuart was only 13 years old, she wrote a book called Being Amelia. This book became very popular. Being Amelia is a little bit about Janine’s own life. In an interview, Janine said, "Because of my dad’s job, my family moved a lot, so I got good at making new friends. I know what it’s like to be the new student in a class, and that helped me write about Amelia, the main character, starting at a new school. Some funny parts of the book are about Amelia’s life at home, especially with her older brother. I don’t have any brothers or sisters, so I had to imagine that part." Janine started writing her book one summer when she was bored at home. Her mom always wanted to be a writer, and her teachers told her she should write, so it seemed like a good idea for Janine. The year before, she won a short story competition on a website for young writers. That’s why, when Janine finished Being Amelia and sent it to a publishing company, they wanted to read it right away. They loved it, and a year later, Janine’s book was in stores. One review of Being Amelia says that even though the book has pictures of happy teenagers on the cover, the people in the story have some hard problems, and this makes readers believe in them. The reviewer says that even though Janine is young and her book is not very long, she is a better writer than some other famous authors. Janine is still getting used to being a famous writer. "At first, I hid when people knew who I was on the street, but now it’s OK. I’d like to give advice to other young writers, but they have to find what works for them. For me, I just spend time with my friends, and then I have something interesting to write about!"

My name is Tom. I am fifteen years old. Three years ago, my family and I moved to a castle on a small island. This happened because my dad got a job as the castle's manager. He works for a group that takes care of old buildings and lets people visit them. Dad was happy because he thought he might not get such a good chance again. It took some time for us to agree that he should take the job. We were worried about living on the island. We thought the castle might not be as nice as our home across the water, and there was no school on the island. But after we moved, we got used to living there. The castle is not very beautiful, but our apartment inside is nice. In summer, the island is busy with many visitors, and there are often parties on the beach. In winter, we only see the other families who live on the island, and there are not many teenagers, which I hoped for. The adults help each other with fixing things on the island, which is hard work. The biggest change for me was taking a boat every day to my old school. I was excited to travel on stormy days with big waves, but the boats don’t go then! I learned that if I miss the bus to the harbour after school, I miss the last boat home, which is scary. So when my friends come to visit, I always tell them to hurry! But we often see amazing views, like the sunset over the sea. Some days, it is so foggy that you can’t see anything, and then it becomes sunny again, which is still surprising to me. We do have bad storms, and I sometimes worry if the castle is strong enough. But then I remember it has been here for hundreds of years, and it is still standing!

I live in a house in the beautiful countryside of Scotland. I love nature and wild animals. Six years ago, I started a new hobby called birdwatching. I went to some mountains in northern Scotland with my family. We saw many birds in their natural home. I spent hours watching them with my parents. They taught me how to tell different birds apart and where to find them. It was amazing! After we came back home, I joined a local birdwatchers' club for young people. My goal is to see 200 different kinds of birds. I am close to reaching this goal because, on family holidays, I have seen birds from other countries too. We always look for places with birdwatching activities, so I can add new birds to my list. I have been to Egypt, and last summer we went to South America. I thought I would see my 200th bird there. I didn’t see it, but I learned that you need to be patient with this hobby. I made a video about my birdwatching challenge and put it online. Many teenagers liked it and said it looked like a fun hobby. My teachers saw the video and asked me to give a presentation about birdwatching at school. I was not nervous until I walked onto the stage. I had notes to help me, but the whole school and all my friends were watching! I felt better when it was over, and the teachers said I did a good job. I might do another presentation next year! I am lucky to live in the countryside. I understand why teenagers in cities might not think about birdwatching, but there are many birds to see, especially in green areas. I think birdwatching clubs should try to get more young people interested. Everyone should connect with nature, and it doesn’t have to cost much money.

I started playing football when I was 7 years old. I would hurry home from school to play with other boys and girls. I loved playing, and soon I became a good player. My family knew I often liked new hobbies and then stopped them, so they thought I would stop playing football too. But I didn’t stop. I dreamed of playing football as a job when I grew up. 

One day, I played in a local tournament, and a referee saw that I was a good player. He told the manager of a professional women’s club to watch me play. The manager liked how I played and asked me to join her club. I was surprised because I didn’t know young girls could join women’s clubs. I started training with the club when I was 13 years old. I got much better at football. 

Some people still thought I wouldn’t be a star player, and this made me a bit sad. But my coach told me to be myself and believe in myself. He even let me play in a big match for the club, earlier than I thought I would. I ran very hard because I didn’t want the other players to blame me if we lost. By luck, I scored the winning goal. I could hear my coach cheering for me, and after the match, the team carried me around the field. It was fantastic! 

Since then, I have scored many more winning goals. Next month, my coach and I are organizing a football tournament in my area. We want to get teenagers interested in football and let them talk to other players in my club. They will see what it’s like to play for a top team if they work hard. My advice to them is the same as my coach’s advice to me: you will have good times, but be ready for bad times too. I have had very few bad times, so I have been lucky!

In the UK and around the world, schools and universities are now encouraging students to start doing research early in their studies. Research is not just for famous scholars or scientists. It is a way to learn and build skills. Research skills are useful for both studying and working because they help us think about the world and our tasks. As a student, you help create new knowledge. You do this by asking questions like Why? How? When? What does this mean? What if things were different? These questions are part of what we call research.

Research can be very complex and done by experts, but it can also be simple and part of everyday life. For example, when you plan a holiday, grow plants, fix things, train a pet, or shop online, you are doing research. In college, you are expected to ask questions, explore information, and create your own ideas. Some students might find this hard because, in some places, knowledge is seen as something you get from teachers and books without questioning. But in the UK, US, and many other places, it is important to question what you learn.

Critical thinking is very important in research. We need to think about what we read and hear, not just accept it as true. We should check if the information is logical and supported by evidence. We should not just believe everything we are told.

Cities have always been places where people think and create new ideas. In the 18th century, people in London met in coffee houses to talk about science and politics. In Paris, artist Pablo Picasso talked about modern art in cafés. But living in a city is not always easy. The same London coffee houses also spread diseases like cholera, and Picasso eventually moved to the countryside. 

Cities are full of creativity, but they can also be stressful and unnatural. Scientists are now studying how city life affects our brains. They found that cities can make our thinking slower. One reason is the lack of nature. Studies show that hospital patients get better faster when they can see trees. Even a small view of nature helps our brains because it gives us a break from city life.

More people now live in cities than ever before. We are crowded into busy places with many strangers. This can affect our mental and physical health. Walking in a busy city street, our brains have to pay attention to many things: people, traffic, and the city layout. This takes a lot of energy. In nature, our brains can relax more because there are fewer things to worry about. This idea is called attention restoration theory, created by psychologist Stephen Kaplan. Nature helps our brains rest and recover.

Long ago, people like philosophers and park designers knew that cities could be hard on our minds. They wanted to bring nature into cities. Parks like Central Park in New York give people a break from city life. A well-designed park can help our brains work better in just a few minutes. While people try many things to improve thinking, like energy drinks or new office designs, a simple walk in nature is often more effective.

Despite the problems of city life, cities keep growing. They are still places where new ideas are born. Research shows that the busy and crowded parts of cities help create new ideas. Just like 18th-century London, modern cities like Cambridge, Massachusetts, are centers of creativity. Less crowded cities might have fewer new ideas over time.

The challenge is to reduce the stress of city life while keeping its benefits. Sometimes, people want to leave nature and go back to the city for its excitement and opportunities.

Where is the mind? This might seem like a strange question. We usually think that thinking happens inside our heads. Today, we have special machines that can show this. But I believe we should not only look inside the head to study the mind. There is a lot of evidence, from long ago to now, that shows things outside our heads also help us think. For example, in archaeology, we see that stone tools, jewelry, carvings, clay tokens, and writing systems have helped humans grow and think. So, I think that what is outside the head can also be part of the mind.

Many people think the mind and the brain are the same. This is because scientists often study people without the things around them. This is important for brain studies, but it makes us forget that we also think with things outside our heads. I am not saying the brain is not important, but I think the mind is more than just the brain. I have a new idea called Material Engagement Theory (MET). MET looks at how things become part of our thinking, like when we use clay to make numbers or use a stone to make a tool. It also studies how this has changed over time and what it means for how we think.

Think about a blind person with a stick. Where does this person’s self start? The stick and the person work together. The stick helps the person feel and see. The brain treats the stick as part of the body. This shows that human intelligence can change a lot by using new tools. I see the human mind as always changing and growing. The 'stick' can be anything from old stone tools to the internet. It helps us understand and explore the world. For humans, tools help us learn and know more. This is why humans make things, and these things help shape our minds. I call this metaplasticity – our minds change as we use different tools. MET helps us understand how things like stone tools or smartphones change how we think and who we are. Humans have used mind-changing tools since they first appeared.

Photography is an invention that has changed the world a lot. In the United States, photography became very important in many areas like science, industry, art, and entertainment. Historians say photography is one of the biggest contributions of the US to the visual arts. To understand its impact, we need to look at its start in the mid-19th century.

Photography was popular for several reasons. First, it was a mechanical process, which matched the US love for new technology. Like trains and electricity, photography helped people see the world more easily. Second, people used cameras to show their identity and create images of themselves and their families. This was important in a country where people often changed and reinvented themselves. Third, photographs were realistic and showed everyday life, which was a trend in US art.

Photographs are like messages, showing us what the photographer wants us to see. They are made by machines, so they are records of real things. But they also show the photographer's personal view. People often think photographs are a 'universal language' because they show things we recognize. However, understanding a photograph can be complex. We need to consider why it was taken and how it was first seen. The same photograph can mean different things in different places and times.

In recent years, artists have used photographs in their work. For example, US artist Andy Warhol used photographs in his paintings and other art forms. Today, photography is an important part of art, working together with painting to show how we see the world.

In 1890, William James, an American thinker and doctor, called psychology the "science of mental life." This idea is still useful today. We all have thoughts and feelings, so we have some idea of what this means. Psychology can be studied in animals like rats and monkeys, but it is mostly about humans. James thought human psychology had basic parts: thoughts and feelings, the world around us, and how we know about these things. Our understanding is personal and comes from our own experiences. Sometimes, we think we know why people act a certain way, like feeling sad or quitting a job. But people can see things differently. Psychology tries to find out which explanations are correct. It helps us know the difference between our own ideas and scientific facts. 

Psychologists study the mind and brain, but they don't know everything about how the brain works. They learn more by watching how people behave and making guesses about what happens inside us. Studying psychology is hard because we can't see the mind like we can see an engine. We have to guess what is happening by looking at behavior. Psychology is like solving a puzzle. It uses clues from careful observation and logical thinking. 

Psychology wants to describe, understand, predict, and change things it studies. It helps us understand our experiences and improve our lives. Psychology has helped in many areas, like teaching children to read better, making machines safer, and helping people talk about their feelings. People have talked about psychology for a long time, but it has been studied scientifically for only about 150 years. Early psychologists used introspection, which means thinking about their own thoughts, to learn about the mind. But this method has limits. William James said trying to understand the mind this way is like trying to see in the dark. Today, psychologists prefer to study the behavior of others instead of just thinking about their own experiences.

In a simple building in Michigan, USA, there is a place called the Museum of Failed Products. This museum shows products that people did not want to buy. The museum is owned by a company called GfK. Carol Sherry, who runs the museum, thinks each product has a sad story. These products were made by designers, marketers, and salespeople who thought they would be successful.

The museum started by accident. Robert McMath, who used to work in marketing, wanted to collect a library of consumer products. He began buying one of every new product he could find starting in the 1960s. He discovered that most products fail, so his collection became mostly unsuccessful products.

Many people today are very optimistic, which might be why these failed products exist. In meetings, nobody realized the products would not sell. Sometimes, marketers spend more money on a failing product to try to make it sell, even if it is not a good idea.

In the self-help world, people often use "positive visualization." This means imagining things going well, which they believe will make it more likely to happen. However, research by Tali Sharot shows that people often think things will go better than they actually do. People who are not depressed tend to be more optimistic about their abilities.

Psychologist Gabriele Oettingen found that thinking too much about success can actually make people less motivated to reach their goals. For example, people who imagined having a great week at work often achieved less.

Carol Dweck, another psychologist, says that how we think about ability affects how we deal with failure. Some people believe ability is fixed and cannot change. They find failure very upsetting because they think it shows they are not good enough. Others believe ability can grow with effort and see failure as a chance to learn and improve. This second group is usually happier, whether or not they succeed.

Sports teams often play better when they are at home. But why is that? Many people think they know, but sports are changing a lot, and what we thought was true might not be anymore. Two things are making us question this: science and money. Sports scientists want to know what helps players do their best, and they have many ideas about home advantage. People who pay for sports want to know if home advantage still matters. If players get paid a lot, shouldn't they play well anywhere?

What about the fans? Would it matter if a team like Manchester United played some home games in another country to reach more fans? British fans think their team needs their support. They believe their cheering helps the team score goals. But they forget the times when cheering didn't lead to a goal.

There is one thing that seems true: home fans can influence referees. In an experiment, referees watched a game with and without crowd noise. Those who heard the noise were less likely to call fouls against the home team. This shows that referees might avoid making decisions that upset the home crowd.

Studies show that home advantage is less than it used to be, but it still exists. In the 1890s, home teams in England won 70% of the time, but now it's about 60%. Travel used to be hard, but now players travel in comfort. Stadiums are also more similar now.

Home advantage is different in each sport. Basketball teams benefit the most from playing at home, followed by football teams. Baseball teams have the least home advantage. This might be because baseball is more about individual players, while basketball needs teamwork. Playing at home might make teams feel more confident.

Another reason for home advantage could be that players feel more protective of their home ground. Before home games, players have higher testosterone levels, which might make them more aggressive.
